{"metadata":{"objective":"Building body paragraphs","lastStepAudioPath":"summary","audioPath":"CS17/5/Refresher"},"steps":[{"headerText":"","leftText":"<p><span class=\"ju-cktitle\" style=\"color:#025B5B;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:22px;font-weight:bold;\">No distractions, intense effects, and more!</span><br /><br />You are entering a contest to win ten free tickets to the movies!&nbsp; To win the contest, you have to write an essay explaining why you believe that going to the movies is better than staying home and watching TV<span style=\"color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 18.4px; orphans: auto; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 1; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; display: inline !important; float: none; background-color: rgb(242, 242, 242);\">.</span><br /><br />You have written an introduction in the mini-lesson <em>Beginning with a compelling introduction</em> and you have a lot of great ideas organized into a writing web from the mini-lesson on <em>Planning and organizing</em>.&nbsp; Now it&#39;s time to write the body paragraphs you need to build your essay.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <img alt=\"A diagram shows the parts of an essay:  the introduction, body paragraph 1, body paragraph 2, body paragraph 3, and the conclusion.  The 3 body paragraphs are between the introduction and conclusion.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","settings":{"showHeader":0,"showAudio":1,"audioPath":"1","hideRightPanel":0,"showNext":1,"delayStep":"0","delayRight":"0"}},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"2"},"leftText":"<p>Your thesis statement helps you organize the body of the essay.&nbsp; For the essay you are writing about why going to the movies is better than staying home and watching TV, the thesis statement has three parts.&nbsp;<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Thesis statement from the contest essay:</span></p><p>Going to the movies is better than staying home because <span class=\"marker\">there are no distractions or interruptions at the movies</span>; <span class=\"marker\">the audio and visual experiences are more intense at the movies</span>; and <span class=\"marker\">making the effort&nbsp; to get out and go to a movie theater is a more active use of my time</span>.</p>","headerText":"Planning the body of the essay"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"3"},"leftText":"<p>Each of the three parts of the thesis statement will become the main idea of a body paragraph.<br /><br />Three body paragraphs plus an introduction and a conclusion will give you a five paragraph essay.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Body Paragraph 1 main idea:</span></p><p>There are no distractions or interruptions at the movies.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Body Paragraph 2 main idea:</span></p><p>The audio and visual experiences are more intense at the movies.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Body Paragraph 3 main idea:</span></p><p>Making the effort to get out and go to a movie theater is a more active use of my time.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"4"},"leftText":"<p>Your thesis statement and its parts can be represented visually by a web.<br /><br /><img alt=\"\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" />For more information on using a web to organize your ideas, see the mini-lesson on <em>Planning and organizing.</em></p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-normal\" style=\"color:black;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:16px;\"><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Writing Web for the thesis statement:&nbsp;&nbsp;</span> </span></p><p><img alt=\"Part of your writing web.  The large center circle says going to the movies is better than watching TV at home.   The reasons listed in the three smaller circles surrounding the large center circle are no distractions, the audio visual experience is better, and more active.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"5"},"leftText":"<p>A body paragraph should have two parts:<br /><br />1.&nbsp;a <strong>topic sentence</strong> that tells the main ideas<br /><br />2.&nbsp;<strong>supporting details</strong><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <img alt=\"A diagram shows the two parts of a body paragraph.   The first part is the topic sentence.   The second part is the details that support the topic sentence.  The second part usually has several sentences.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","headerText":"Writing a body paragraph"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"6"},"leftText":"<p>The <strong>topic sentence</strong> is usually at the beginning of a body paragraph<strong>.</strong>&nbsp; The topic sentence lets the reader know what the paragraph is about and includes the main idea.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Topic sentence about the many species in the rainforest:</span></p><p>The rainforest is important to everyone on Earth because it supports a multitude of species that exist nowhere else.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Topic sentence about no distractions at the movies:</span></p><p>When I decide to spend a few hours seeing a movie in a theater, I know that I&nbsp;am leaving&nbsp;many distractions and interruptions at home.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"7"},"leftText":"<p>A body paragraph needs <strong>several convincing details</strong> that <strong>support</strong> the main idea.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Main idea:&nbsp;</span></p><p>The rainforest is important to everyone on Earth because it supports a multitude of species.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Details:</span></p><p>Many species that live in the rainforest are not found anywhere else on Earth.</p><p>Many things that we eat grow in the rainforest.</p><p>Important medicinal products come from the rainforest.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"8"},"leftText":"<p>Each body paragraph should discuss a single main idea.&nbsp; If you include supporting details for a main idea that is not in the paragraph, you will not communicate your ideas as clearly to your reader.<br /><br />In this example, the sentence about seeing a brand new movie does not fit with the rest of the information in this paragraph.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Main idea:</span></p><p>There are fewer distractions at the movies than at home.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Details:</span></p><p><span class=\"ju-greencheckph\" style=\"color:#08A47D;font-weight:bold;\">v</span> You will not be tempted to check email.</p><p><span class=\"ju-greencheckph\" style=\"color:#08A47D;font-weight:bold;\">v</span> There are no chores to do.</p><p><span class=\"ju-orangetimesph\" style=\"color:#F79A1F;font-weight:bold;\">x</span> When I have the chance to see a brand new movie on the weekend it opens, it is a special treat.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"9"},"leftText":"<p>Instead, substitute a third fact about the lack of interruptions when out at a movie theater.<br /><br /><br /><img alt=\"\" src=\"/images/picture_it.png\" style=\"width: 27px; height: 27px;\" />&nbsp; <a href=\"S3_BUCKET_/CS17/5/Pictureit_Strongbodyparagraph.pdf\" onclick=\"window.open(this.href, '', 'resizable=yes,status=no,location=no,toolbar=no,menubar=no,fullscreen=no,scrollbars=no,dependent=yes,width=826,left=100,height=750,top=50'); return false;\">Build strong body paragraphs: Picture it!</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href=\"S3_BUCKET_/CS17/5/Screen_reader_picture_it_strong_body_paragraph.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"\" src=\"/images/accessible_icon.png\" style=\"width: 17px; height: 20px;\" /><span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">Screen reader version of build strong body paragraphs, opens in a new tab</span></a><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Main idea:</span></p><p>There are fewer distractions at the movies than at home.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Details:</span></p><p><span class=\"ju-greencheckph\" style=\"color:#08A47D;font-weight:bold;\">v</span> You will not be tempted to check email.</p><p><span class=\"ju-greencheckph\" style=\"color:#08A47D;font-weight:bold;\">v</span> There are no chores to do.</p><p><span class=\"ju-greencheckph\" style=\"color:#08A47D;font-weight:bold;\"><span class=\"ju-orangetimesph\">v</span></span> Friends and neighbors will not stop by.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"10"},"leftText":"<p>You can expand the web you used for your thesis statement to organize your ideas and make sure that each paragraph includes several supporting details to use as evidence or an explanation about the main idea.<br /><br /><img alt=\"\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" />For more information on using a web to organize your ideas, see the mini-lesson on <em>Planning and organizing.</em><br /><br />The main idea for your first body paragraph is that there are no distractions or interruptions.<br /><br />Think about those interruptions and include convincing details for your reader.</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Writing Web for No distractions:</span><img alt=\"A short version of the main idea for your first body paragraph is listed in a circle.  It says no distractons.    The three small circles surrounding the no distractions circle list your details and examples.   They say no unexpected friends or neighbors, no work emails, and no chores or housework.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","headerText":"The contest essay: Body Paragraph 1"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"11"},"leftText":"<p>As you develop your details, remember your <strong>purpose.</strong><br /><br />You are writing to convince your audience why&nbsp;going to the movies is better than staying at home to watch TV.&nbsp; You&nbsp;already have brainstormed ideas.&nbsp; Now it is time to put them in strong sentences so your readers understand your ideas.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Sentences that describe the No distractions details:</span><br /><br />While my eyes are glued to the big screen, I am not able to open my computer and check my work email, even for a minute.</p><p>There is no way I can take care of housework or jobs around the house. Those things simply have to wait.&nbsp;</p><p>Although I like my neighbors, it is a pleasure to watch a movie without interruptions from great friends stopping by to talk.&nbsp;</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"12"},"leftText":"<p>Here is a first draft of the first body paragraph.&nbsp; When you write, you should always plan to go back over what you have written to revise and edit it.<br /><br />The first body paragraph includes a topic sentence and a sentence for each of the three supporting details from the writing web.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Body Paragraph 1:</span></p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td>When I decide to spend a few hours seeing a movie in a theater, I know that I am leaving many distractions and interruptions at home.&nbsp; While my eyes are glued to the big screen, I am not able to open my computer and check my work email, even for a minute.&nbsp; There is no way I can take care of housework or jobs around the house.&nbsp; Those things simply have to wait.&nbsp; Although I like my neighbors, it is a pleasure to watch a movie without interruptions from great friends stopping by to talk.&nbsp;</td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"13"},"leftText":"<p>Review the writing web for the thesis statement that is at the beginning of the mini-lesson.&nbsp;The main idea for the second paragraph of the contest essay is this:<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">The audiovisual experience is better at the movies.</span><br /><br />Brainstorm supporting details that will convince your reader&nbsp;and organize them into a writing web.&nbsp;<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Writing Web for The&nbsp;audio-visual experience is better: &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <img alt=\"A short version of the main idea for your second body paragraph is listed in a circle.  It says &quot;the audio visual experience is better.&quot;  The three small circles surrounding the audio visual experience is better circle list your details and examples.   They say larger screen, better sound, and engineered to feel immersive.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","headerText":"The contest essay: Body Paragraphs 2 and 3"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"14"},"leftText":"<p>Here is the first draft of the second paragraph.&nbsp;<br /><br />It includes a topic sentence and a sentence for each of the three supporting details from the writing web.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Body Paragraph 2:</span></p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td>If you have not visited your local theater or cinema lately, you will be amazed at how the current technology has enhanced the experience of watching a movie.&nbsp; The size of the screen and placement of stadium seating provides a visual experience that cannot be created on TV at home.&nbsp; The surround sound experience makes the dialogue, music, and sound effects come alive for the audience.&nbsp; Finally, new techniques allow the viewer to be immersed in the movie, truly bringing you to places you have never been.&nbsp;</td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"15"},"leftText":"<p>You would follow the same steps to write your third body paragraph.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Writing Web for <em>going to the movies is more active than staying at home</em>:</span></p><p><img alt=\"\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","headerText":""},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"16"},"leftText":"<table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-summary\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><thead><tr><th scope=\"col\">Remember!</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><p>Your essay should include three body paragraphs that develop the ideas from the thesis statement.&nbsp; Each body paragraph should</p><ul><li>have a topic sentence.</li><li>include details that support the topic sentence.</li><li>be about a single idea.</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table>","rightText":null,"headerText":"Putting it all together"},{"settings":{"showAudio":0,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0},"leftText":"<p>Here is the essay so far.&nbsp; Remember that it is just a first draft!<br /><br />It includes an introductory paragraph from the mini-lesson <em>Beginning with a compelling introduction&nbsp;</em>and three body paragraphs.<br /><br />If you need more help, go back to the&nbsp;<em>Writing a winning essay</em> menu and choose one of the other mini-lessons to learn about writing your first draft&nbsp;and revising your essay to make it better.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"ju-normal\" style=\"box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; color: black;\">Essay<br style=\"box-sizing: border-box;\" />Why Going to the Movies Is Better Than Watching TV</span></p><p><a href=\"S3_BUCKET_/CS17/5/BodyParagraphs.pdf\" onclick=\"window.open(this.href, '', 'resizable=yes,status=no,location=no,toolbar=no,menubar=no,fullscreen=no,scrollbars=yes,dependent=no,width=800,left=100,height=600,top=50');
